meanings.definition: To prepare or flavor (food) by the addition of a spice or spices.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys currying her dishes with a hint of cinnamon.
meanings.sent2: The chef is currying the soup with a blend of herbs.
meanings.sent3: Currying the stew with a touch of paprika made it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the curry leaves currying the rice filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: Currying the chicken with turmeric gave it a vibrant color.

meanings.definition: To rub and clean (a horse) with a currycomb.
meanings.sent1: The stable hand is currying the horse before the race.
meanings.sent2: Currying the horse's coat helps keep it healthy and shiny.
meanings.sent3: The horse seemed to enjoy the gentle currying of its mane.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the currycomb currying the horse's back was soothing.
meanings.sent5: Currying the horse is an essential part of grooming for the show.

meanings.definition: To seek to gain favor by flattery or attention.
meanings.sent1: He was currying favor with his boss by praising her work.
meanings.sent2: Currying favor with others can sometimes backfire.
meanings.sent3: Currying attention by exaggerating stories can lead to disbelief.
meanings.sent4: She was currying favor with the teacher to get a better grade.
meanings.sent5: Currying attention by being overly dramatic is not always effective.
